comment: Review complete. SOP-005 meets all review criteria: (1) Purpose and scope are clear and well-defined. (2) Definitions are complete and accurate - six key terms defined. (3) Procedures are actionable and unambiguous - clear workflows for Execution Branch and Genesis Sandbox models, adoption process, versioning, and traceability. (4) Three ASCII diagrams are clear and helpful. (5) Document follows SOP format conventions. Content accurately reflects CR-010 proposed content. Recommend approval.

Review complete with explicit frontmatter verification per CAPA-002. FRONTMATTER CHECK: (1) title field present - PASS. (2) revision_summary field present - PASS. (3) revision_summary references authorizing CR (CR-010) - PASS. (4) Format complies with SOP-001 Section 5.1 and SOP-002 Section 8 - PASS. The nonconformance identified in INV-002 has been corrected. Document content unchanged from v1.0. Recommend approval.

COMPLIANT. Full verification of CR-015 EI-3 changes: (1) Frontmatter: title='Code Governance', revision_summary='CR-015: Align SDLC document types with SOP-006', (2) DS.md removed from repository structure examples (lines 86-90 now show only RS.md and RTM.md), (3) Key Principles line 99 shows '(RS, RTM)' not '(DS, RTM)', (4) Adoption CR scope line 198 shows '(RS, RTM)' not '(RS, DS, RTM)', (5) Workflow diagram lines 227-228 show only RS.md and RTM.md, (6) SDLC document references comment (line 289) updated to 'RS.md or RTM.md', (7) Line 295 says 'The document describes' not 'The DS describes', (8) Section 10.2 (lines 318-320) no longer has 'DS references implementation files'. Full document scan confirms no remaining DS/CS/OQ references. No placeholder content. Recommend for approval.

REVIEW: REQUEST UPDATES

Frontmatter verified:
- title: "Code Governance" (unchanged)
- revision_summary: "CR-083: Codify merge gate, qualified commit convention, and merge type requirements in Section 7.1" (references CR ID, descriptive)

Structure: All sections present and correctly numbered. New subsections 7.1.1-7.1.4 properly nested under 7.1.

Placeholder check: No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found.

Scope compliance: All changes confined to Section 7.1 as authorized by CR-083 EI-1. Sections 1-6, 7.2, 7.3, and 8-11 are unchanged from effective. No scope creep.

Content: Qualified commit definition (7.1.2), merge gate prerequisites (7.1.3), and rationale (7.1.4) are technically sound and internally consistent. Cross-references to SOP-006 Section 7.2 are valid. ASCII diagram in 7.1.1 is clean and readable.

DEFICIENCY -- Formatting inconsistency (dash characters):

The effective SOP-005 uses em-dashes throughout the document in 8 locations:
- Section 7.1 heading: "Standard Model — Frequent"
- Section 7.2 heading: "Rare — New Systems Only"
- Section 11 heading: "Summary — When to Use What"
- Multiple prose locations in Sections 7.3, 8, 8.4, 9.1

The new Section 7.1 content replaces the em-dash in the heading with double hyphens and introduces double hyphens in 3 additional locations:
- Line 126: "Standard Model -- Frequent" (was "—")
- Line 141: "Run tests -- all must pass"
- Line 170: "execution branch commit -- not a merge commit"
- Line 187: "verify -- at that exact commit"

Meanwhile, unchanged sections retain em-dashes (Section 7.2 heading, Section 7.3, Section 8, etc.). The document now uses two different conventions for the same typographic element, which is a formatting inconsistency.

Resolution: Either normalize all em-dashes to double hyphens throughout the document, or use em-dashes in the new Section 7.1 content to match the existing convention. The latter is simpler since it only touches the new content.

RE-REVIEW: RECOMMEND

Previous deficiency (dash formatting inconsistency) has been resolved.

Verification of fix:
- Line 126: Section 7.1 heading now uses em-dash: "Standard Model — Frequent" -- matches Section 7.2 "Rare — New Systems Only"
- Line 170: Section 7.1.2 prose now uses em-dash: "execution branch commit — not a merge commit"
- Line 187: Section 7.1.4 prose now uses em-dashes: "verify — at that exact commit — that all tests passed"
- Line 141: Double hyphens remain inside ASCII code block diagram ("Run tests -- all must pass") -- correct, code blocks should not use typographic characters

Em-dash usage is now consistent throughout: 10 instances across the document (3 new in Section 7.1, 7 existing in unchanged sections). The single remaining double-hyphen is appropriately inside a code block.

No other changes introduced beyond the dash corrections. All findings from the prior review (frontmatter, structure, scope compliance, content quality, cross-references, placeholder check) remain valid and passing.

REVIEW: COMPLIANT. Changes verified against CR-086 Section 5.5 scope.

FRONTMATTER: title = "Code Governance" (unchanged). revision_summary = "CR-086: Add Section 7.1.5 rollback procedures for execution branch and main branch scenarios" -- references CR-086, descriptive.

CHANGE VERIFICATION (New Section 7.1.5):
- Header: "#### 7.1.5 Rollback Procedures" at correct level (####, matching 7.1.1-7.1.4) -- CONFIRMED.
- Insertion point: After 7.1.4 (Why Merge Type Matters), before 7.2 (Genesis Sandbox) -- CONFIRMED.
- Section numbering integrity: 7.1.1, 7.1.2, 7.1.3, 7.1.4, 7.1.5, 7.2 -- CONFIRMED.

EXECUTION BRANCH ROLLBACK (4 steps):
1. "Revert or fix commits on the execution branch" -- CONFIRMED.
2. "Re-run tests, verify CI passes" -- CONFIRMED.
3. "Update the qualified commit hash in the RTM if it changed" -- CONFIRMED.
4. "Document the rollback in the CR execution record" -- CONFIRMED.
Additional explanatory note about main branch being unaffected (references merge gate in 7.1.3) -- adds clarity, consistent with scope.

MAIN BRANCH ROLLBACK (5 steps):
1. "Create a new CR documenting the rollback (per SOP-002 Section 10)" -- CONFIRMED.
2. "Use `git revert` on the merge commit to undo the change on main" -- CONFIRMED.
3. "Verify all tests pass on the reverted state" -- CONFIRMED.
4. "Update SDLC documents (RS/RTM) to reflect the reverted state" -- CONFIRMED.
5. "The original CR remains closed -- the rollback CR provides the audit trail" -- CONFIRMED.

PROHIBITION: "`git revert` is the only acceptable approach. `git reset` is prohibited because it does not preserve history. The original commits must remain reachable for audit purposes." -- CONFIRMED.

SCOPE CONTAINMENT: All sections outside 7.1.5 (Sections 1-6, 7.1.1-7.1.4, 7.2-7.3, 8-11) are identical to effective v4.0. No unintended changes.

PLACEHOLDERS: None found.
TYPOS: None found.
FORMATTING: Consistent with existing section conventions (bold subsection headings, numbered lists, inline code for git commands).

QA Review of SOP-005 v5.1 — RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "Code Governance" — present and non-empty, unchanged from v5.0
- revision_summary: "CR-093: Add submodule pointer update step to Section 7.1.1 workflow and submodule guidance to Section 7.1.3 merge gate" — present, references authorizing CR-093 per SOP-002 Section 8

CHANGE VERIFICATION (diff of v5.0 effective vs. v5.1 draft):
Exactly two changes identified, both within pre-approved scope of CR-093 Section 5.1:

1. Section 7.1.1 Workflow diagram: New step 7 added — "Update parent repo submodule pointer (7.1.3)". Previous step 7 ("Document work in CR") renumbered to step 8. Step numbering is sequential and correct (1-8).

2. Section 7.1.3 Merge Gate: New paragraph added after the existing "Fast-forward merge" paragraph — "Submodule pointer update (for submodule-based systems):" — explains that merging to a submodule's main branch is necessary but not sufficient, and that the parent repository must update its submodule pointer. Includes rationale (traceability chain).

NO OTHER CHANGES DETECTED. All other sections (1-6, 7.1.2, 7.1.4, 7.1.5, 7.2, 7.3, 8-11) are identical to the effective v5.0.

SCOPE ALIGNMENT WITH CR-093:
- CR-093 Section 5.1 specifies: "Add step 7 to the numbered list and workflow diagram" — DONE
- CR-093 Section 5.1 specifies: "Add a paragraph after the existing fast-forward merge guidance addressing the submodule pointer update requirement" — DONE
- No changes outside pre-approved scope. PASS

CONTENT QUALITY:
- New step 7 includes cross-reference to Section 7.1.3 for details — consistent with existing cross-reference style (step 4 refs 7.1.2, step 6 refs 7.1.3). PASS
- New 7.1.3 paragraph uses bold label format consistent with existing paragraphs ("Required merge type:", "Prohibited merge type:", "Fast-forward merge:"). PASS
- New paragraph explains both the requirement and the rationale (traceability chain), consistent with the explanatory style of existing 7.1.3 content. PASS
- No spelling or grammar errors found. PASS

PLACEHOLDER VERIFICATION:
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, XXX found. PASS

FORMATTING:
- Section numbering unaffected (all sections remain correctly numbered). PASS
- Markdown formatting consistent with document style. PASS

FINDING: COMPLIANT. Changes are minimal, precisely scoped to CR-093's pre-approved plan, and consistent with document style.
